newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani stocks slip lower on Moody's review.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani stocks slip lower on Moody's review.

text.p: Pakistani stocks slipped on Tuesday as investors offloaded blue chips fearing a downgrade by Moody's Investors Service Inc which has placed Pakistan's credit rating under review, dealers said.
They said the move by Moody's had eroded investor confidence already shaken by Pakistan's political and economic problems.
The Karachi 100-share index fell 12.58 points, or 0.89 percent, to end at 1,405.47. Losers led gainers 129 to 88.
Turnover rose to 23 million shares from 16 million in the previous session.
Faysal Bank fell 1.65 rupees to 20.35 rupees. Dewan Salman Fibre fell 0.50 to 22. Hub Power fell 1.25 to 32.50 and Pakistan State Oil 3.0 to 332. Shell Pakistan rose 8.0 to 140.
PTCL fell 0.60 to 33.60. Fauji Fertilizer rose 1.30 to 71. ICI Pakistan fell 1.30 to 16.20.
